title: Unravelling the molecular basis of subunit specificity in bacterial pilus assembly mechanisms
abstractText: This is a joint grant application PI: Professor Sheena Radford Co-PIs: Dr. Alison Ashcroft and Professor Gabriel Waksman Reference: G52950X Objectives, Summaries, Technical Summary, Beneficiaries, and Case for Support for this application can be found under Professor Sheena Radford's submission
impactText: In this grant, we provided fundamental insights into the role the various domains of the PapC usher play in pilus biogenesis. We also provided fundamental insights into subunit ordering within the pilus and the mechanism by which subunits are selected for assembly. Pharmaceuticals and Medical Biotechnology Economic
findingsText: This grant was very successful. We discovered the mechanism by which pilus subunits are selected by the usher and assembled in the defined way. This work defines the molecular basis for subunit selection by the usher and thus can be used to screen for compounds inhibiting the process. Pharmaceuticals and Medical Biotechnology
